channel.title: Reviews - Spackle | Bathroom Renovations On Your Terms

item.title: "I’m happy I got SPACKLED"
item.dc:creator: hadar Wissotzky
item.description:
When I learned of mySpackle.com it was a prayer being answered. The cumulative talent, experience, and sincere interest in the success of MY bathroom remodels couldn’t be found in my market. The money saved by avoiding mistakes from my inexperience along with the professional creative design makes me look like an expert to my family and friends. I’m happy I got SPACKLED”
—John in South Carolina

item.title: "The confidence that we needed"
item.dc:creator: hadar Wissotzky
item.description:
"As a DIYer renovating a master bathroom I thought I could take on the project myself no problem. I wasn’t wrong, but I have zero experience in tile, plumbing, or drywall to name a few. I needed a coach! Then when it came to shopping and design, we became indecisive on everything and needed help! Spackle provided coaching through YouTube and design and shopping through personal communication. Being one phone call away for any question or next step took all our indecision away and gave us confidence that we needed to take on this renovation!"
—Zach & Hannah in Michigan
item.content:encoded:
It all begins with an idea. Maybe you want to launch a business. Maybe you want to turn a hobby into something more. Or maybe you have a creative project to share with the world. Whatever it is, the way you tell your story online can make all the difference.

Don’t worry about sounding professional. Sound like you. There are over 1.5 billion websites out there, but your story is what’s going to separate this one from the rest. If you read the words back and don’t hear your own voice in your head, that’s a good sign you still have more work to do.

Be clear, be confident and don’t overthink it. The beauty of your story is that it’s going to continue to evolve and your site can evolve with it. Your goal should be to make it feel right for right now. Later will take care of itself. It always does.

item.title: "Our custom design is stunning"
item.dc:creator: hadar Wissotzky
item.description:
"Spackle helped us gain the confidence to finally renovate our dream bathroom. M+C have been so incredible with advice and motivation equally. Our custom design is stunning with the most beautiful finishes and we cannot wait for this dream to become reality!"
—Jon & JoJo in California
item.content:encoded:
It all begins with an idea. Maybe you want to launch a business. Maybe you want to turn a hobby into something more. Or maybe you have a creative project to share with the world. Whatever it is, the way you tell your story online can make all the difference.

Don’t worry about sounding professional. Sound like you. There are over 1.5 billion websites out there, but your story is what’s going to separate this one from the rest. If you read the words back and don’t hear your own voice in your head, that’s a good sign you still have more work to do.

Be clear, be confident and don’t overthink it. The beauty of your story is that it’s going to continue to evolve and your site can evolve with it. Your goal should be to make it feel right for right now. Later will take care of itself. It always does.
